New Records: Jos Buttler became England’s leading scorer in men’s T20Is on the night he won his 100th cap.
Key Match Events: Jos Buttler scored a superbly-paced 73 off 47 balls.
Glenn Phillips scored 62 runs for New Zealand.
Sam Curran took 2 wickets for 26 runs.
Mark Wood and Ben Stokes took crucial wickets towards the end.
Chris Woakes redeemed himself with a brilliant 17th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler chose to bat first on a used pitch.
England had a lot of success batting first this year.
Eoin Morgan expected the pitch to spin.
Post-Match Reflections: England's victory keeps them on track for the semi-finals.
New Zealand’s net run rate is healthy enough that they will almost certainly qualify for the semi-finals by beating Ireland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Gabba in Brisbane.
The pitch had something for the spinners to work with.
